newsitem.title: MALAYSIA: Camerlin completes Brierley stake buy.
newsitem.headline: Camerlin completes Brierley stake buy.

text.p: Malaysia's Camerlin Group Bhd said on Saturday it has completed the acquisition of a 20 percent equity interest in Brierley Investments Ltd of New Zealand.

Camerlin, formerly Malex Industries Bhd, said in a statement issued by its merchant bankers that the company has also completed the acquisition of a 39.44 percent equity interest in Southern Steel Bhd.

Singapore's First Capital Corp Ltd last year announced that its 40-percent associate Camerlin Pte Ltd was selling its 20 percent stake in investment group Brierley to Camerlin Group (then Malex) for 1.42 billion ringgit.
Camerlin Group would pay 710.33 million ringgit in cash and the balance of 710.33 million ringgit by way of new Camerlin Group shares.
On Southern Steel, Camerlin Group was to pay 566 million ringgit for the equity interest in the Malaysian steel products firm by issuing new Camerlin Group shares.
Camerlin Group also announced that it has completed a three-for-two bonus issue, a two-for-one rights and the issue of 46.8 million new shares to Bumiputra (ethnic Malay) shareholders.
